title: Jessica Valenti on Abortion with Alexis McGill Johnson
description: Feminist writer and activist Jessica Valenti discusses the state of abortion access and her book, 'Abortion: Our Bodies, Their Lies, and the Truths We Use to Win,' in a conversation with Alexis McGill Johnson, president and CEO of Planned Parenthood of America.
address: Brooklyn Public Library, Central Library, Prospect Heights

title: Adam Wade: Live in New York
description: 20-time Moth story slam winner Adam Wade returns to Under St. Marks Theater with a storytelling show featuring three to four different stories from his extensive catalog (no two shows will be the same) and a different special guest who’ll kick things off.
address: Under St. Marks Theater, East Village

title: Adsit + You
description: Comedian and former 30 Rock cast member Scott Adsit takes the stage at UCB for a night of spontaneous, two-person scenes—featuring (possibly) you. Audience members can volunteer to improvise alongside him, or just sit back and watch everything unfold.

title: Motion Picture Pop Quiz
description: Screening party meets trivia competition at Motion Picture Pop Quiz, where you'll watch short clips from movies, TV shows, and news reports while entertainers craft questions on the spot. Answers are judged on correctness or creativity, with winners chosen by a random drawing.

title: We Have Fun: A Stand-Up Show
description: Hosts Zach Sims and Dan Wilbur bring the fun-ny to Young Ethel’s, with stand-up by guests Shalewa Sharpe, Billy Prinsell, Julie Mitchell, and Max Chavez.

title: The Moth Storyslam
description: The popular community-based open mic storytelling competition, where anyone can share a five-minute tale based on the evening’s theme to an attentive audience, returns to The Bell House. Tonight’s theme: ‘Oblivious.’

title: Friends with Caveats
description: Expect everything from stand-up and character performances to music and even PowerPoint presentations at Caveat's new weekly comedy show, 'Friends with Caveats.' Tonight's lineup includes Jessie Lee, Jenny Gorelick, Kenice Mobley, Molly Brown, and more.

title: Late Bloomers
description: Naomi Odenkirk presents Late Bloomers, an evening of unexpected solo characters at Union Hall. Featuring Sarafina Ludlow, Kate Owens, Ashley Padilla, Mary Shalaby, Jamie Linn Watson, and Jane Wickline. Hosted by Ava Bunn.

title: Restaurant Week of the Sides
description: 38 businesses along the 7-train line in Sunnyside and Woodside, Queens, offer three-course dinner specials for $35.

title: Sixth Chelsea International Photography Competition Exhibition
description: Chelsea's Agora Gallery presents its sixth annual photography competition exhibition, showcasing winning works from hundreds of global submissions. Reception Thursday 6-8pm. Free admission.

title: Brooklyn Books + Booze
description: Hear established and up-and-coming authors of different genres read from their current works every third Tuesday of the month at Barrow's Intense Tasting Room. Tonight's lineup includes Alaya Dawn Johnson, Taran Hunt, Veronica Schanoes, and John Foster. Hosted by Randee Dawn.
address: Barrow's Intense Tasting Room, Industry City

title: Astronomy on Tap: 150
description: A night where astronomy enthusiasts gather at a bar for talks by professional scientists and educators, plus themed games, and other cosmic fun. Tonight’s 150th event features community manager at Science Friday Santiago Flórez and Columbia University astronomy graduate student Shreyas Seethalla.

title: David Briggs at the Great Organ
description: The Cathedral Church of Saint John the Divine celebrates the return of its restored great organ with free performances this month. Tonight, Cathedral artist in residence David Briggs premieres his organ transcription of Brahms’ passionate 2nd symphony alongside his own ‘Mannahatta Diptyque,’ a musical tour of NYC throughout history.
address: Cathedral Church of Saint John the Divine, Morningside Heights

title: Animation Nights New York
description: Watch a curated program of animated short films from around the world at this monthly screening event.

title: 13th Annual Winter Film Festival
description: The winter film festival returns for its 13th year, showcasing over 80 films from 20 countries, including animation, documentaries, dramas, comedies, horror, music videos, and web series by emerging talent. Look cinemas (Hell’s Kitchen), $12.50 adv, $16.50 door, $5 for students.
